intro: Henckelia papillosa, commonly known as the hairy henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and unique botanical features, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
